5: I can't really figure why he is a manaless champion. It seems like mana would work just fine for his kit. Was it just to weaken things like iceborn on him?

6: Finally, I see he has no ap scaling. I notice a lot of ad champs are having less and less ap scaling. I like the, less than viable, ap builds, (gangplank, tristana, kog'maw, etc.) And I was wondering why you guys don't do that anymore.  Ap Kled sounds fun.

> 1: What was the best bug?

There was an accident once where uhhh.... we turned a number down by accident. It resulted into a cowboy rodeo where Kled constantly dismount and Skaarl kept coming back. Or it was the time where I accidentally spawned way too many Skaarls, and yes, they all run back to Kled as a horde. 

> 3: Kled's kit, aside from is passive. Is one of the simplest you guys have made in a while. What are your feelings about this, and was there anything crazier tried in development.

Since the champ had a complicated passive that changed his form and involved risk taking, we wanted to keep complexity low elsewhere on the kit

> 4: I have been dying to know, for his ult. Why does Skarrl roll into a ball, and not simply charge. It just feels off to me.

As far as I know, we have too many running / charging at'em animations. We needed something more HAM-burgers. Something more recognizable, and through the magic of mushroom juice and our talented animators, we got the animation we have now.

> 5: I can't really figure why he is a manaless champion. It seems like mana would work just fine for his kit. Was it just to weaken things like iceborn on him?

Bars. Too many Bars. A Skaarl HP Bar, a Courage bar, Kled HP Bar and Mana bar was way too many things for Kled to track. Also looked super messy on the screen

There was also a bug where if Morde made a Kled ghost, it would never ever die - when the buff expired, Kled would dismount, turn invisible, and poke enemies in secret for the rest of the game.

I also liked the one where if you dismounted, Skaarl suddenly grew to 100x normal size and lumbered over to a brush and disappeared.
You guys really need to record these things and show us. I must see my favorite champs derping out in development.

Naming characters is a strangely lengthy process.  First I make a document with goals for the character's name and combine that with a phonic/ language study for the region the champ is from.    Then I make a list of 50 to 100 names.  Myself, the team and leadership chose 10 favorites.  These are then sent to our localization teams to check for pronunciation and possible horrible meanings in other territories.   Then the final names are chosen (from the final 2 or 3 survivors).
